isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - REASSEMBLE - INSTALL THE DIFFERENTIAL

step1.para: Clean and dry the bearing cups and bores of the carrier legs and bearing caps.
Apply axle lubricant on the inner diameter of the bearing cups and on both bearing cones that are assembled on the case halves.
Apply Loctite Sleeve N' Mount No. 609 (Green) Adhesive in the bearing bores of the carrier legs and bearing caps. Refer to APPLICATION OF ADHESIVE IN BEARING BORES. See Figure 98.

figure.caption: Figure 98. Apply Loctite Adhesive in Bearing Bores of Carrier Legs and Bearing Caps

step1.para: Install the bearing cups over the bearing cones that are assembled on the case halves ( Figure 99).

figure.caption: Figure 99. Install Bearing Cups Over Bearing Cones

step1.para: Safely lift the differential and ring gear assembly and install into the carrier. The bearing cups MUST be flat against the bores between the carrier legs ( Figure 99).
Install both of the bearing adjusting rings into position between the carrier legs. Turn each adjusting ring hand tight against the bearing cup ( Figure 100).

figure.caption: Figure 100. Install Bearing Adjusting Rings Between Carrier Legs

step1.para: Install the bearing caps over the bearings and adjusting rings in the correct location as marked before removal ( Figure 101).

figure.caption: Figure 101. Install Bearings Caps Over Bearings and Adjusting Rings

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection. Do not hit steel parts with a steel hammer. Parts can break and cause injury.

step1.para: Hit each bearing cap into position with a leather, plastic or rubber mallet. The caps MUST fit easily against the bearings, adjusting rings and carrier. DO NOT FORCE THE BEARING CAPS INTO POSITION.

caution.para: If bearing caps are not installed in correct locations, the bores and threads in caps will not match the carrier. You will have problems assembling the caps on the carrier and damage to parts can occur. Do not force the bearing caps into position.

step1.para: If bearing caps do not correctly fit into position, check the alignment of match marks between caps and carrier. Remove the caps and repeat Step 6.

Install the capscrews and washers that hold bearing caps to the carrier. Tighten the capscrews by hand four to six turns, then tighten the capscrews to the correct torque value. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.

note.para: Do not install the cotter keys *, pins * or lock plates * that hold the bearing adjusting rings in position. Continue by adjusting the preload of differential bearings, adjust backlash of the hypoid gear and check tooth contact patterns.
